intro: Anemonoides felix, commonly known as the golden anemone, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features showy, saucer-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are aromatic and often covered in a fine, white down. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Anemonoides felix is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to naturalize in suitable climates.
